intro: Tragia senegalensis, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that can be toxic if ingested. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Tragia senegalensis is also used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
